Lagi-lagi Pertumbuhan Ekonomi RI Mentok di 5%
06 Nov 2019, 01:08 by Danang Sugianto


Foto: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia di kuartal III-2019 sebesar 5,02% year on year (yoy). Angka ini jauh lebih rendah dari kuartal III-2018 sebesar 5,17%.Kepala BPS Suhariyanto mengatakan, catatan nilai pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal III ini disebabkan realisasi investasi yang masih rendah.Selain itu perekonomian global pun diprediksi masih mengalami perlambatan. Hal ini terjadi karena perang dagang Amerika Serikat (AS)-China yang masih terjadi. Berikut berita selengkapnya:Suhariyanto mengatakan pertumbuhan ekonomi dipengaruhi sejumlah faktor seperti kondisi ekonomi global. Dia bilang, perang dagang antara Amerika Serikat (AS) dengan China hingga tensi politik masih jadi tantangan.Selain itu, harga komoditas migas dan non migas yang mengalami penurunan secara global yang mempengaruhi pertumbuhan ekonomi kuartal III-2019. "Untuk minyak ICP rata-rata harga di triwulan III-2018 US$ 71,64 per barel. Tapi pada triwulan II-2019 jatuh jadi US$ 59,81 per barel," kata Suhariyanto di Gedung BPS, Selasa (5/11/2019).Selain global, faktor dalam negeri seperti realisasi belanja pemerintah juga ikut memengaruhi ekonomi Indonesia. Pada triwulan III-2019 ini, realisasi belanja pemerintah hanya 22,75% dari pagu anggaran."Kalau dilihat lebih dalam penurunan realisasi belanja pemerintah, karena turunnya realisasi belanja pemerintah pusat. Ini berpengaruh pada komponen belanja pemerintah. Perlu jadi catatan bahwa besarnya realisasi investasi di BKPM hanya 14-15% dari total PNBP yang ada di PDB," jelasnya.Konsumsi mobil disebutkan Suhariyanto juga melambat, sementara produksi semen naik 35,09%. Peristiwa ini juga mempengaruhi pertumbuhan ekonomi di kuartal II-2019. Selain itu, Suhariyanto mengatakan, ada 9 sektor yang pertumbuhannya masih lambat. Salah satunya industri migas dan batu bara."Ada juga industri yang mengalami kontraksi misalnya industri batu bara dan migas kontraksi 0,74%. Industri alat angkutan juga kontraksi 1,23%. Dengan pergerakan masing-masih sub sektor industri. Industri pengolahan masih tumbuh 4,15%. Pertanian masih tumbuh 3,08%" tuturnya.Lanjut ke halaman berikutnya >>>(das/ang)

Again, Indonesia's economic growth is stuck at 5%
Nov 6 2019, 01:08 by Danang Sugianto


Photo: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) recorded Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 of 5.02% year on year (yoy). This figure is much lower than the quarter III-2018 of 5.17%. Head of BPS Suhariyanto said the record value of economic growth in the third quarter was due to investment realization that was still low. In addition, the global economy was also predicted to experience a slowdown. This happens because the trade war of the United States (US) -China is still happening. The following is complete news: Suhariyanto said economic growth was influenced by a number of factors such as global economic conditions. He said, the trade war between the United States (US) and China to political tension was still a challenge. In addition, oil and gas and non-oil commodity prices were experiencing a global decline which affected economic growth in the third quarter of 2019. "For ICP oil, the average price in the third quarter of 2018 was US $ 71.64 per barrel. But in the second quarter of 2019 it fell to US $ 59.81 per barrel," Suhariyanto said at the BPS Building, Tuesday (11/5 / 2019). Besides global factors, domestic factors such as the realization of government spending also influence the Indonesian economy. In the third quarter of 2019, the realization of government spending was only 22.75% of the budget ceiling. "If we look deeper into the decline in realization of government spending, due to the decline in the realization of central government spending. This affects the government expenditure component. It should be noted that the amount of investment realization in BKPM only 14-15% of the total PNBP in GDP, "he explained. The consumption of cars mentioned Suhariyanto also slowed, while cement production rose 35.09%. This event also affected economic growth in the second quarter of 2019. In addition, Suhariyanto said, there were 9 sectors whose growth was still slow. One of them is the oil and gas industry and coal. "There are also industries that experienced contractions, for example the coal and oil and gas industries contracted 0.74%. The transportation equipment industry also contracted 1.23%. With the movement of each of the industrial sub-sectors. The manufacturing industry is still growing 4.15%. Agriculture is still growing 3.08% "he said. Continue to the next page >>> (das / ang)
